ISSUE.TITLE: Supabase Swift docs - `.order("table", ascending:, foreignTable: )` should be `.order("table", ascending:, referencedTable: )`
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: # Improve documentation ## Link https://supabase.com/docs/reference/swift/order ## Describe the problem Documentation is wrong for the `.order` modifier on a foreign table. Docs say: ``` try await supabase .from("countries") .select( """ name, cities ( name ) """ ) .order("name", ascending: false, foreignTable: "cities") .execute() ``` `foreignTable` is invalid - this should be `referencedTable`. ## Describe the improvement Update docs to say: ``` try await supabase .from("countries") .select( """ name, cities ( name ) """ ) .order("name", ascending: false, referencedTable: "cities") .execute() ```

COMMIT.MESSAGE: update swift docs to use referencedTable instead of foreignTable. Closes #29966
update swift docs to use referencedTable instead of foreignTable. Closes #29966 (#29968)
update swift docs to use referencedTable instead of foreignTable. Closes #29966 (#29968)
